EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.  
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.  
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.  
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.  
 – In step 1288 the lab was connected to the steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5), although its status remains NO_POWER.
• Electricity Group comprising:
 – Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).  
 – Additional poles recently placed:  
  • At (x=-7.5, y=16.5) – successfully connected (step 1280).  
  • At (x=-10.5, y=18.5) – placement succeeded but connection failed (step 1283).  
  • At (x=-8.5, y=13.5) – placed and connected (step 1286).
• Merged network poles at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and (x=-17.5, y=16.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network:
 – Group 1: positions (x=-10.5, y=16.5) and (x=-12.5, y=18.5).  
 – Group 2: positions (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5).
• Steam Engines:
 – Steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=16.5); serves as the target for lab power and fluid integration (status: NOT_CONNECTED regarding fluid supply).  
 – Steam engine at (x=-14.5, y=13.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=13.5).  
 – Steam engine at (x=7.5, y=35.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED).  
 – Steam engine at (x=8.5, y=20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED).
• Fluid System Submodule:
 – Boiler Module:  
  • Boiler successfully placed at (x=-16.0, y=23.5) in step 1292 after crafting prerequisites (harvested stone, crafted stone-furnace, then boiler). Coal (10 units) was inserted into the boiler.  
  • Multiple connection attempts—from manual rerouting via an intermediate waypoint at (x=-13.5, y=23.5), an adjusted waypoint at (x=-15.0, y=20.0), and a direct connection attempt targeting the steam engine—failed to establish a valid fluid connection.
 – Offshore Pump Attempt:  
  • An offshore pump was crafted (step 1290) and placed at (x=60.5, y=-152.5); this pump remains NOT_CONNECTED.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) operating (status: WORKING).  
• Boiler at (x=-29.0, y=33.5) for fluid heating.  
• Pipe Connection re-established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) and continuing through positions (x=-30.5, y=34.5), (x=-30.5, y=35.5) and (x=-30.5, y=36.5).

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Positional Occupancy:
 – Validate candidate positions for placements by ensuring sufficient clearance and that target tiles are unoccupied by other entities.

• Pole Placement & Spacing:
 – Precheck for collisions with existing poles, pipes, or fixed structures before placing electric poles near sensitive areas like labs.

• Connection Failures:
 – For fluid system integrations, ensure that all required components (boiler, offshore pump, pipes) are present in adequate quantities prior to connection attempts.  
 – Confirm that source outputs (e.g. boiler) and target inputs (e.g. steam engine) have compatible and unobstructed connection points.  
 – When employing intermediate waypoints for manual fluid rerouting, verify that pipeline inventories (pipe count) and alignment meet the connection requirements.

• Crafting Dependencies:
 – Ensure harvesting of necessary raw resources before initiating crafting operations (e.g. sufficient stone to craft a stone-furnace needed for boiler production, and adequate iron-plate for pipe crafting).

• Type Handling & General Resource Management:
 – Use appropriate methods on objects and confirm correct type usage to prevent nil reference errors.  
 – Pre-calculate material and network configuration parameters to avoid placement or connection conflicts.
